name: cis-v1.23-t1.0.1
description: Testing CIS for Kubernetes as suggested by CIS in https://workbench.cisecurity.org/benchmarks/8973

patch.name: CIS-1.1.1 Ensure that the API server pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.2 Ensure that the API server pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.3 Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.4 Ensure that the controller manager pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.5 Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.6 Ensure that the scheduler pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.7 Ensure that the etcd pod specification file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.8 Ensure that the etcd pod specification file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.9 Ensure that the Container Network Interface file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.10 Ensure that the Container Network Interface file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.11 Ensure that the etcd data directory permissions are set to 700 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.12 Ensure that the etcd data directory ownership is set to etcd:etcd
CIS-1.1.13 Ensure that the admin.conf file permissions are set to 600
CIS-1.1.14 Ensure that the admin.conf file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.15 Ensure that the scheduler.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.16 Ensure that the scheduler.conf file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.17 Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.18 Ensure that the controller-manager.conf file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.19 Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI directory and file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-1.1.20 Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI certificate file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-1.1.21 Ensure that the Kubernetes PKI key file permissions are set to 600
CIS-1.2.1 Ensure that the API Server --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
CIS-1.2.2 Ensure that the API Server --token-auth-file parameter is not set
CIS-1.2.3 Ensure that the API Server --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set
CIS-1.2.4 Ensure that the API Server --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.5 Ensure that the API Server --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.6 Ensure that the API Server --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
CIS-1.2.7 Ensure that the API Server --authorization-mode argument includes Node
CIS-1.2.8 Ensure that the API Server --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
CIS-1.2.9 Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
CIS-1.2.10 Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
CIS-1.2.11 Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
CIS-1.2.12 Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
CIS-1.2.13 Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
CIS-1.2.14 Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
CIS-1.2.15 Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
CIS-1.2.16 Ensure that the API Server --secure-port argument is not set to 0
CIS-1.2.17 Ensure that the API Server --profiling argument is set to false
CIS-1.2.18 Ensure that the API Server --audit-log-path argument is set
CIS-1.2.19 Ensure that the API Server --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate
CIS-1.2.20 Ensure that the API Server --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate
CIS-1.2.21 Ensure that the API Server --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate
CIS-1.2.22 Ensure that the API Server --request-timeout argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.23 Ensure that the API Server --service-account-lookup argument is set to true
CIS-1.2.24 Ensure that the API Server --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.25 Ensure that the API Server --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.26 Ensure that the API Server --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.27 Ensure that the API Server --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.28 Ensure that the API Server --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.29 Ensure that the API Server --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.2.30 Ensure that encryption providers are appropriately configured
CIS-1.2.31 Ensure that the API Server only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
CIS-1.3.1 Ensure that the Controller Manager --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.3.2 Ensure that the Controller Manager --profiling argument is set to false
CIS-1.3.3 Ensure that the Controller Manager --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
CIS-1.3.4 Ensure that the Controller Manager --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.3.5 Ensure that the Controller Manager --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
CIS-1.3.6 Ensure that the Controller Manager RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
CIS-1.3.7 Ensure that the Controller Manager --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
CIS-1.4.1 Ensure that the Scheduler --profiling argument is set to false
CIS-1.4.2 Ensure that the Scheduler --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
CIS-2.1 Ensure that the --cert-file and --key-file arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-2.2 Ensure that the --client-cert-auth argument is set to true
CIS-2.3 Ensure that the --auto-tls argument is not set to true
CIS-2.4 Ensure that the --peer-cert-file and --peer-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-2.5 Ensure that the --peer-client-cert-auth argument is set to true
CIS-2.6 Ensure that the --peer-auto-tls argument is not set to true
CIS-2.7 Ensure that a unique Certificate Authority is used for etcd
CIS-3.2.1 Ensure that a minimal audit policy is created
CIS-3.2.2 Ensure that the audit policy covers key security concerns
CIS-4.1.1 Ensure that the kubelet service file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-4.1.2 Ensure that the kubelet service file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-4.1.3 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-4.1.4 If proxy kubeconfig file exists ensure ownership is set to root:root
CIS-4.1.5 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-4.1.6 Ensure that the --kubeconfig kubelet.conf file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-4.1.7 Ensure that the certificate authorities file permissions are set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-4.1.8 Ensure that the client certificate authorities file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-4.1.9 If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate permissions set to 600 or more restrictive
CIS-4.1.10 If the kubelet config.yaml configuration file is being used validate file ownership is set to root:root
CIS-4.2.1 Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
CIS-4.2.2 Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
CIS-4.2.3 Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
CIS-4.2.4 Verify that the --read-only-port argument is set to 0
CIS-4.2.5 Ensure that the --streaming-connection-idle-timeout argument is not set to 0
CIS-4.2.6 Ensure that the --protect-kernel-defaults argument is set to true
CIS-4.2.7 Ensure that the --make-iptables-util-chains argument is set to true
CIS-4.2.8 Ensure that the --hostname-override argument is not set
CIS-4.2.9 Ensure that the --event-qps argument is set to 0 or a level which ensures appropriate event capture
CIS-4.2.10 Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
CIS-4.2.11 Ensure that the --rotate-certificates argument is not set to false
CIS-4.2.12 Verify that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
CIS-4.2.13 Ensure that the Kubelet only makes use of Strong Cryptographic Ciphers
CIS-5.1.1 Ensure that the cluster-admin role is only used where required
CIS-5.1.2 Minimize access to secrets
CIS-5.1.3 Minimize wildcard use in Roles and ClusterRoles
CIS-5.1.4 Minimize access to create pods
CIS-5.1.5 Ensure that default service accounts are not actively used
CIS-5.1.6 Ensure that Service Account Tokens are only mounted where necessary
CIS-5.1.8 Limit use of the Bind, Impersonate and Escalate permissions in the Kubernetes cluster
CIS-5.2.1 Ensure that the cluster has at least one active policy control mechanism in place
CIS-5.2.2 Minimize the admission of privileged containers
CIS-5.2.3 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
CIS-5.2.4 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
CIS-5.2.5 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
CIS-5.2.6 Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation
CIS-5.2.7 Minimize the admission of root containers
CIS-5.2.8 Minimize the admission of containers with the NET_RAW capability
CIS-5.2.9 Minimize the admission of containers with added capabilities
CIS-5.2.10 Minimize the admission of containers with capabilities assigned
CIS-5.2.11 Minimize the admission of Windows HostProcess Containers
CIS-5.2.12 Minimize the admission of HostPath volumes
CIS-5.2.13 Minimize the admission of containers which use HostPorts
CIS-5.3.1 Ensure that the CNI in use supports Network Policies
CIS-5.3.2 Ensure that all Namespaces have Network Policies defined
CIS-5.4.1 Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables
CIS-5.4.1 Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables
CIS-5.4.1 Prefer using secrets as files over secrets as environment variables
CIS-5.4.2 Consider external secret storage
CIS-5.7.1 Create administrative boundaries between resources using namespaces
CIS-5.7.2 Ensure that the seccomp profile is set to docker/default in your pod definitions
CIS-5.7.3 Apply Security Context to Your Pods and Containers
CIS-5.7.4 The default namespace should not be used
